text: if you visit eateries in central Vietnam
selling chicken rice sticky rice or
noodles you will see a few condiment
jars ready put on the table so you can
add to your individual bowl or blades to
customize to your preference and one of
them will be the sweet chili GMS many
tourists have fallen in love with this
and send me requests for a recipe let's
begin recipe you will need about 500
gram of chili peppers you can use
jalapenos or a mix of chilies and
tomatoes
if you contact too spicy I have here 300
gram of chilies and 200 gram of tomatoes
use a paring knife to make the slash
along the Chili Peppers bring a large
pot of water to a boil and then we're
going to blanch the chilies and tomatoes
for about 2 to 3 minutes then remove and
transfer to a bowl ice-cold water to
maintain the beautiful chilly colors
peel the tomatoes remove the seeds and
cut into small chunks also remove the
seeds of the chiles and the stems too
don't forget to put on clothes you
really don't want to do directly with
the chiles and then touch your body
later also cut the chili into smaller
pieces and add into a blender
then blend well we'll have a cup of
water PU one large head of garlic and
also for shallots thinly slice the
shallots and then crush the garlic in a
mortar pestle into a paste next hit
about three tablespoons of vegetable oil
in a pan and then add the powdered
garlic and shallots and frighten to
quite golden mmm is smell really good
now it's time to pouring the chilli and
tomato puree also add 2/3 cup or 130
gram of sugar and half a teaspoon of
salt stir well and then simmer for about
30 to 40 minutes until the chilli sauce
thickens occasionally give it a good
stir and also scrape down the sides when
it's taken up to your liking add a
quarter cup of roasted sesame then turn
off the heat and it's done lekin
completely before putting into a jar now
the chili Jemez is ready to serve you
can make it a dipping sauce or put on
top of any dish put into the jam on top
of a piece of rice cracker used to be
one of my childhood favorite snacks it's
sweet and spicy and the garlic shallots
and roasted sesame give it a really nice
fragrance if you are a chilli lover I'm
sure you're gonna need a future of these
on the shelf you can keep the charts in
the fridge for a few weeks if you want
to keep them longer
you can pour a thin layer or vegetable
oil on top if you liked the video don't
forget to give it a thumbs up and check
out my playlist to have more ideas what
to prepare for the upcoming holiday
thank you for watching bye bye
